title._content: Pulpit Rock, scene of Jeff. Davis' speech at Lookout Mountain (LOC)

description._content: Barnard, George N.,, 1819-1902,, photographer. Pulpit Rock, scene of Jeff. Davis' speech at Lookout Mountain [1864?] 1 photographic print on stereo card : stereograph, albumen ; 3.25 x 6.75 in. Notes: Photograph shows a man standing at Pulpit Rock adjacent to a tripod signal erected by Captains Dorr and Donn of U.S. Coast Survey and used for making topographic maps on Lookout Mountain, near Chattanooga, Tennessee. (Source: Caption for negative LC-B811-3661) Title from item. No. 3. Original neg. for this print: LC-B811-3661. Forms part of: Visual materials from the papers of O.M. Poe. Subjects: Surveying equipment--Tennessee--Lookout Mountain--1860-1870. Rock formations--Tennessee--Lookout Mountain--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Engineering & construction--Union--Tennessee--Lookout Mountain. Format: Stereographs--1860-1870. Albumen prints--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA Part Of: Visual materials from the papers of O. M. Poe (DLC) 00651883 Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.1s01390 hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.2s01390 Call Number: LOT 13464, no. 4
